availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Bracken County, Kentucky, shoemaker. Kentucky native. Married to Melissa B. Hamilton on November 27, 1849. Father of John D. Walker, William M. Walker, and Henry L. Walker. Appointed U.S. Postmaster June 22, 1858. Shoemaker in Bracken County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Bracken County, p. 471B.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Bracken County, Eastern District, p. 129.
Kentucky, County Marriage Records, 1783-1965, TH-1-9999-13035-87, Bracken County, November 27, 1849 (accessed via Ancestry.com).
Record of Appointment of Postmasters, 1832-1971, NARA Microfilm Publication, M841, Records of the Post Office Department, Record Group Number 28, Bracken County, Brooksville, p. 20, (accessed via Ancestry.com).
